newsitem.title: ITALY: Talks on Olivetti PC sale continue - sources.
newsitem.headline: Talks on Olivetti PC sale continue - sources.

text.p: Negotiations between Italian information technology group Olivetti and a consortium of investors over the sale of its troubled PC business are still continuing, sources close to the interested parties said.
Italian newspapers speculated at the weekend that a deal could be finalised as early as today.

Gianmario Rossignolo, chairman of Electrolux unit Zanussi, has joined forces with U.S. financier Edward Gottesman who heads the London-based Centenary Group in a bid for the personal computer company.

"We are continuing to work on the deal optimistically, but there's nothing really new with regards to the last few days," said the source, adding that the deal was likely to be concluded in the coming days.
